snippet: Three governments have been removed from power since 2006, and for the last five months, protesters in Bangkok have demanded the overthrow of the government and a reduction in the influence of the Shinawatra clan.
abstract: Three governments in Thailand, nation of many ethnic groups, have been removed from power since 2006 and protesters in Bangkok have been demanding the overthrow of the Shinawatra clan; prospect that a fourth democratically elected government could be removed by the courts has been met by seething anger in villages across Thailand's north and northeast regions.
lead_paragraph: Three governments have been removed from power since 2006, and for the last five months, protesters in Bangkok have demanded the overthrow of the government and a reduction in the influence of the Shinawatra clan.

headline.main: Thailand’s Political Tensions Are Rekindling Ethnic and Regional Divisions
headline.print_headline: Thailand’s Political Tensions Are Rekindling Ethnic and Regional Divisions
